statement.tex: \text{A factory makes tennis rackets and cricket bats.}\\ \text{A tennis racket takes 1.5 hours of machine time}\\ \text{and 3 hours of a craftman's time in its making, }\\ \text{while a cricket bat takes 3 hours of machine time}\\ \text{and 1 hour of a craftman's time to make it.}\\ \text{In a day, the factory has the availability of not more}\\ \text{than 42 hours of machine time and 24 hours of a}\\ \text{craftsman's time.}\\ \text{(i) What number of rackets and bats must be made}\\ \text{if the factory is to work at full capacity?}\\ \text{(ii) If the profit on a racket and on a bat is Rs.20 and}\\ \text{Rs.10 respectively, find the maximum profit of the factory.}

step.context: \text{If the factory produces x rackets and y bats in a }\\ \text{day, what functions represent}\\ \text{(i) Maximum capacity C(x, y)}\\ \text{(ii) Maximum profit P(x, y)}
step.tex: \text{(i) For maximum capacity}\\ \begin{align} \qquad C(x, y) &= x(unit)+y(unit) \\ \implies C(x, y) &= x+y \end{align}\\ \text{(i) For maximum profit}\\ \begin{align} \qquad P(x, y) &= x(unit)\cdot 20(Rs/unit)+ y(unit)\cdot 10(Rs/unit) \\ \implies P(x, y) &= 20x+10y \end{align}

\text{(i) For maximum capacity}\\ \begin{align} \qquad C(x, y) &= 2x(unit)+y(unit) \\ \implies C(x, y) &= 2x+y \end{align}\\ \text{(i) For maximum profit}\\ \begin{align} \qquad P(x, y) &= 2x(unit)\cdot 10(Rs/unit)+ y(unit)\cdot 20(Rs/unit) \\ \implies P(x, y) &= 20x+20y \end{align}
step.reason: \text{The output of the factory is the simply sum of the}\\ \text{total number of rackets and bats it can produce.}\\ \text{Maximum profitability is the weighted sum by per unit}\\ \text{profit that the sale of rackets and bats generate.}

step.tex: \text{Machine time limitation}\\ \begin{align} \qquad &x(rackets)\cdot 1.5(hours/racket)+ y(bats)\cdot 3(hours/bat) \le 42 \\ \implies &1.5x + 3y\le 42 \\ \implies &x/2 + y\le 14 \end{align}\\ \text{Craftsmen time limitation}\\ \begin{align} \qquad &x(rackets)\cdot 3(hours/racket)+ y(bats)\cdot 1(hour/bat) \le 24\\ \implies &3x+y\le 24 \end{align}\\ \text{Number of items produces cannot be negative,}\\ x\ge 0,\, y\ge 0

\text{Machine time limitation}\\ \begin{align} \qquad &x(rackets)\cdot 1.5(hours/racket)+ y(bats)\cdot 3(hours/bat) \ge 42 \\ \implies &1.5x + 3y\ge 42 \\ \implies &x/2 + y\ge 14 \end{align}\\ \text{Craftsmen time limitation}\\ \begin{align} \qquad &x(rackets)\cdot 3(hours/racket)+ y(bats)\cdot 1(hour/bat) \ge 24\\ \implies &3x+y\ge 24 \end{align}\\ \text{Number of items produces cannot be negative,}\\ x\ge 0,\, y\ge 0
step.reason: \text{To find the time for which any resource is occupied, }\\ \text{multiply the time on each resource needed by an item}\\ \text{with the total number of that item being produced.}\\ \text{Thereafter, ensure that the total time a resource is}\\ \text{needed for, is LESS than the total time it is available for}
\text{As per the constraints, the feasible region,}\\ \text{is bounded by the x and y axes and the area}\\ \text{below lines }x/2+y=14 \text{ and } 3x+y=24

step.context: \text{Can we predict }\\ \text{(i) the full capacity of the factory, and}\\ \text{(ii) it's maximum profitability }\\ \text{based on corner points in the diagram above?}
